Comment: It's ok for CoC

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is good.

Hi!

Are names that contain only digits considered Alien Name? For example, is "123" an Alien Name? Are names with lower and upper case letters human names? For example, is "jOHn" considered a Human Name?

Also, the construction "If the name ends with an uppercase Latin character, it is classified as a Star Name.. if it does not qualify as an Alien Name" creates confusion. Cannot be used "Otherwise it qualifies" Instead of "if it does not qualify"?

nice clash, easily solvable using regex. my golfed attempt in ruby (72 bytes):
n=gets
puts"#{/[a-z]/i&&/\d/=~n ?:Alien:/[A-Z]/=~n ?:Star: :Human} Name"

* Please format all variables using this [[syntax]].

* Please format all possible output as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks around them.

You can get more details on the formatting syntax here:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

* Each pair of test and validator should be *different* but *similar*. Please revise the cases accordingly.

* Please add a write statement to the stub generator, e.g. "write answer".

I'll review and make some other comments after the above points have been followed up.

Thanks.
I think so now its look good..
If we strictly follow the conditions, "123" is a human name, and "jOHn" also human name, but "jOhN" would be a star name.

Goal
* Why are Sun, Antares, Epsilon Aurigae listed as examples of Star Names while they do not end with an uppercase letter?

Input
* Please format "n" as a [[variable]].

Output
* You may simplify the whole section by not repeating the conditions (as they've already been stated in Goal section), like this (also without the word "Print"):

A single line that describes the type of name: {{Alien Name}}, {{Star Name}} or {{Human Name}}.

Constraints
* Please simplify the first constraint as:
2 ‚â§ length of [[n]] ‚â§ 100

* Please format "n" as a [[variable]] in the second and third constraints.

* Please delete the last constraint (Alien Name > Star Name).

Cases
* As mentioned, each pair of cases should be *different* but *similar*. Note that one pair means a test and its corresponding validator.

Thanks.

-----

By the way, this part of your solution can be changed without affecting the outcome:

if have_upper_alpa and have_lower_alpa and have_num and last_is_upper:
    print("Alien Name")
elif have_upper_alpa and have_lower_alpa and have_num:
    print("Alien Name")

becomes:

if have_upper_alpa and have_lower_alpa and have_num:
    print("Alien Name")

I improved many things as you told me. I think so now it's looks good.
In the solution part you was right.. thank you so much...

Yes, it looks better now!

Constraints
* First constraint: Please:

EITHER delete "2‚â§[[n]]‚â§100 ‚Äî " because you cannot compare a string with numbers,

OR change the first constraint to "2 ‚â§ number of characters in [[N]] ‚â§ 100".

* The third constraint may be deleted because you've specified that [[N]] must contain at least 2 characters.

* Please move "Happy Coding!" to Goal section because it's not a constraint.

Cases
* The contribution guidelines specify that the cases (except for edge cases) must be different, so I mentioned twice before that you should revise the cases. I'll give you an example:

Test 1 can still be "Alien123", but Validator 1 may be changed to "Alien456". Other pairs of tests and validators must also be changed such that each pair is *different* but *similar*.

Hope this clarifies.

Thank you.
now?.. is good? and when it will be approved??üòÜüê∏

It's better. Thanks.

It'll normally be approved within 30 days, though sometimes it can take longer.
ok.. nice.. and thanks for you Supportüòò
